section.title: Configuring Applications by Using the OpenAM Console
section.para: This section describes how to use the OpenAM console to create applications, which are used as templates for policies protecting Web sites, Web applications, or other resources.

procedure.title: To Configure an Application by Using the Policy Editor

step.para: In the OpenAM console, select Access Control > Realm Name > Policies.
To create a new application, click Add New Application.
To modify an existing application, in the row containing the application, click the Edit Application icon.
To discard any changes and return to the previous page, click Cancel.
Provide a name for the application, and optionally a description, and then click Next.

xinclude:fallback.para: Special Characters in Policies, Resource Types or Applications missing: shared/para-special-characters.xml

step.para: Select the resource types that policies within this application use as the basis for their rules by following the steps below:
In the Available Resource Types section, click a resource type to move to the Selected Resource Types section.

mediaobject.alt: Move available resource types to the right of the screen to select the resource types that policies in this application use.

textobject.para: Click the arrow to move the resource type to the right.

tip.para: To remove a resource type, click the Delete icon.

step.para: Repeat these steps to add all the resource types your policies may require, and then click Next.

tip.para: If the configuration is not visible, click the maximized link to switch to maximized view.

step.para: To make changes to the configuration, either click the step in the list, or click the item to amend in the Review Configuration and Finish section to jump to the relevant step, and make your changes.
When the configuration is complete, click Finish.

section.para: To make use of the new application and any policies it contains, you must configure a policy agent to use the application for policy decisions.
For details see the procedure To Specify the Realm and Application for Policy Decisions.
